texto:
â€œLa proÌxima vez te castigareÌ como un muchacho malcriadoâ€, dijo el candidato Isidro Romero, en alusioÌn a Guillermo Lasso, por no haberle respondido el saludo de apretoÌn de manos, cuando inicio del Debate Presidencial 2021.

ğŸ‘‰Ante las caÌmaras, el candidato de CREO esbozoÌ una sonrisa mientras Romero, presidencial de Avanza, se quejaba porque no lo habiÌa saludado. â€œA mi nadie me deja de saludarâ€, dijo Romero, de 78 anÌƒos.

El banquero contuvo dos horas la repuesta y la descargoÌ cuando el evento terminoÌ: â€œCoÌmo voy a dar la mano a un tipo que me ha maltratadoâ€, expresoÌ el candidato delante de los periodistas del diario, sus guardaespaldas y quienes lo rodearon.

en:
"Next time I will punish you like a spoiled boy," said candidate Isidro Romero, referring to Guillermo Lasso, for not having responded to the handshake greeting, when the 2021 Presidential Debate began.

ğŸ‘‰In front of the cameras, the CREO candidate outlined a smile while Romero, Avanza's presidential officer, complained that he had not greeted him. "Nobody stops saying hello to me," said Romero, 78.

ğŸ—£The reaction of Lasso, 65, came to the end of the Debate, organized this Saturday night, January 9, 2021 by EL COMERCIO Y TVC. The banker held back the answer for two hours and downloaded it when the event ended: "How am I going to shake hands with a guy who has mistreated me," said the candidate in front of the newspaper's journalists, his bodyguard and those around him.

ğŸ“¸: THE TRADE.

# DebatePresidencial2021 #GuillermoLasso #IsidroRomeroCarbo #Ecuador

texto:
ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ Durante el debate presidencial del martes en Estados Unidos, el candidato demÃ³crata Joe Biden respondiÃ³ en gran medida a las interrupciones de su rival, el presidente Donald Trump, poniendo los ojos en blanco, sacudiendo la cabeza, riendo y haciendo comentarios punzantes como "Vamos, hombre".

Nunca perdiÃ³ los estribos, pero dejÃ³ en claro lo que opina de Trump.

El primer ejemplo se produjo aproximadamente a los 18 minutos de iniciado el debate, cuando Biden respondiÃ³ a una serie de interrupciones de Trump diciendo: "Â¿Por quÃ© no te callas, hombre?".

"Eres el peor presidente que Estados Unidos ha tenido. Vamos", dijo Biden mÃ¡s tarde, mientras los dos debatÃ­an sobre los impuestos y la economÃ­a.

"Es difÃ­cil hablar con este payaso", dijo mÃ¡s tarde.

#debatepresidencial #debate #donaldtrump #joebiden #votolatino
en:
ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ During Tuesday's presidential debate in the United States, Democratic candidate Joe Biden responded largely to the interruptions of his rival, President Donald Trump, by rolling his eyes, shaking his head, laughing and doing Stinging comments like "Come on, man."

He never lost his temper, but he made clear what he thinks of Trump.

The first example came about 18 minutes into the debate, when Biden responded to a series of interruptions from Trump by saying, "Why don't you shut up, man?"

"You are the worst president the United States has ever had. Come on," Biden said later, as the two debated taxes and the economy.

"It's hard to talk to this clown," he said later.

#debatepresidencial #debate #donaldtrump #joebiden #votolatino

texto:
When asked to denounce white supremacy, Donald Trump responded: â€œProud Boys, stand back AND stand by.â€

Joe Biden wasnâ€™t my choice for president. But, as a mother who is raising children, BLACK children in America I refuse to not exercise my right to VOTE against blatant hate and racism.

Let me be very clear: only white people have the privilege to â€œchooseâ€ not to vote for president. The rest of us are deciding between being closer to liberation and moving backwards towards slavery.

ğŸ—£Black voters must vote Joe Biden for President and THEN vote for the most progressive candidates in your local elections.

We canâ€™t afford to have an alt right president with moderate local representatives because theyâ€™ll never push hard enough to stop the bleeding. We canâ€™t afford to have a moderate president with moderate local representation because this is only a bandaid for a gaping wound and doing so is the equivalent of a never ending tug of war. Middle of the road politicians and their policies have never cured the problem, only allowed us to tolerate the problem longer.

Regardless of who becomes President, last nightâ€™s debate proves the only hope we have to save our communities is to vote for representation on a local level who will BOLDLY fight against racism and abuse of power.

#anewnormal #chamaformayor #prefectforpeoria #mayor #2020debate #debatepresidencial #joebiden

texto:
La ComisiÃ³n de Registro Civil y Electoral del Consejo Nacional Electoral (CNE) reiterÃ³ que las actas certificadas de nacimiento, matrimonio y defunciÃ³n no tienen fecha de vencimiento, por lo tanto las instituciones pÃºblicas y privadas deben abstenerse de solicitar a los ciudadanos las copias de estos documentos con su versiÃ³n actualizada o fechas especÃ­ficas.
.
.
El CNE que ya habÃ­a dado anteriormente esa informaciÃ³n pide nuevamente a los Ã³rganos y entes de la administraciÃ³n pÃºblica e instituciones educativas pÃºblicas y privadas, abstenerse de requerir a los ciudadanos dichas certificaciones con una fecha determinada de expediciÃ³n.
.
.
En la actualidad muchos trÃ¡mites exigen partidas de nacimiento, y en la mayorÃ­a de los casos una vigencia no mayor a 5 aÃ±os, algo que el CNE ha reiterado no es necesario.
.
.
.
#30ene #SomosCaraboboEsNoticia #Venezuela #VenezuelaEsNoticia #Sucesos #Noticias #viral #VideoViral #nacionales #SoloEnVenezuela #venezolanosencolombia #venezolanosenperu #venezolanosenecuador #venezolanosenelextranjero #SoloEnVenezuela #venezolanosencolombia #venezolanosenmiami #Pais #CNE
en:
The Civil and Electoral Registry Commission of the National Electoral Council (CNE) reiterated that certified birth, marriage and death certificates do not have an expiration date, therefore public and private institutions must refrain from asking citizens for copies of these documents with their updated version or specific dates.
.
.
The CNE, which had previously provided this information, once again asks the organs and entities of the public administration and public and private educational institutions to refrain from requiring citizens to have said certifications with a specific date of issue.
.
.
Currently many procedures require birth certificates, and in most cases a validity of no more than 5 years, something that the CNE has reiterated is not necessary.
.
.
.
# 30ene #SomosCaraboboEsNoticia #Venezuela #VenezuelaEsNoticia #Events #News #viral #VideoViral #nacionales #SoloEnVenezuela #venezolanosencolombia #venezolanosenperu #venezolanosenecuador #venezolanosenelextranjero #Siavenezo #VeniseVenuelannezestranjero

texto:
Ante las largas filas que los ciudadanos han hecho para sacar la #cÃ©dula en varios puntos de la capital y otras ciudades, el Consejo Nacional Electoral (#CNE) recordÃ³ que se puede sufragar el prÃ³ximo 7 de febrero con el documento caducado.

Hubo personas que se volcaron a tramitar su documento de identidad tras el anuncio del Registro Civil sobre la extensiÃ³n de sus horarios este sÃ¡bado 30 y el prÃ³ximo 6 de febrero para sacar la cÃ©dula. En este horario se priorizarÃ¡ la atenciÃ³n para ciudadanos que no cuenten con su cÃ©dula, por pÃ©rdida o robo, y para quienes requieran obtenerla por primera vez.

Para ampliar la noticia visita www.metroecuador.com.ec
en:
Faced with the long lines that citizens have made to get the # card in various parts of the capital and other cities, the National Electoral Council (#CNE) recalled that it can be paid on February 7 with the expired document.

There were people who turned to processing their identity document after the announcement of the Civil Registry about the extension of their hours this Saturday 30 and next February 6 to get the card. At this time, priority will be given to the attention for citizens who do not have their identity card, due to loss or theft, and for those who need to obtain it for the first time.

To expand the news visit www.metroecuador.com.ec

texto:
#ATENCIÃ“N El circo electorero sigue, con declaraciones que rozan el absurdo. En medio de tantas promesas mentirosas, a ciertos candidatos se les escapa sus verdaderos planes. Y #YakuPerez, candidato de Pachakutik-UP, no es la excepciÃ³n. El 9 de diciembre, en Zamora Chinchipe, declarÃ³ que #Ecuador deberÃ­a sustituir la exportaciÃ³n petrolera por exportaciÃ³n de #agua, el "agÃ¼ita" por la que tanto supuestamente lucha este oportunista arribista electorero. Es decir, una de las propuestas de PÃ©rez serÃ­a seguirnos manteniendo como paÃ­s primario exportador, reprimarizando nuestra economÃ­a, solo cambiando de producto estrella: ya no el petrÃ³leo, ya no el banano, ya no el cacao, supuestamente no la minerÃ­a, sino el AGUA. Esto en el contexto en el que Wall Street acaba de sugerir que el agua deberÃ­a ser cotizada y entrar en el mercado como el petrÃ³leo. En resumen seguir vendiendo nuestros recursos no renovables al #imperialismo. Â¡Gran propuesta de este traficante de la lucha!

Â«Pero para eso hay que cuidarla. Hay que cuidar la naturaleza. Lo mejor de la naturaleza es el agua. Cuidemos la naturaleza, que algÃºn rato podemos ser exportadores de aguaÂ«, seÃ±alÃ³.

Es necesario mirar mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de romanticismos pseudo indÃ­genas y entender de forma objetiva de donde vienen los candidatos y cuÃ¡les son sus intereses de clase. Dentro de la democracia burguesa, quienes se postulan, no son sino tÃ­teres de las Ã©lites y futuros lacayos de los paÃ­ses imperialistas. Â¡ArranquÃ©mosles las mÃ¡scaras a los electoreros! Y si quieres elegir, Â¡ELIGE LUCHAR!

#YoNoVotoLUCHO
#naturainsurrecta #elecciones2021ecuador #electoreros #politiquerosecuador #ecuador #agua #water #cambioclimatico
en:
# ATTENTION The electoral circus continues, with statements that border on the absurd. Amid so many lying promises, certain candidates miss their true plans. And #YakuPerez, candidate of Pachakutik-UP, is no exception. On December 9, in Zamora Chinchipe, he declared that #Ecuador should substitute oil exports for exports of #agua, the "water" for which this opportunist voter upstart allegedly fights. In other words, one of PÃ©rez's proposals would be to continue keeping ourselves as the primary exporting country, reprimarising our economy, only changing the star product: no longer oil, no longer bananas, no longer cocoa, supposedly not mining, but WATER . This in the context in which Wall Street has just suggested that water should be priced and enter the market like oil. In short, keep selling our non-renewable resources to #imperialism. Great proposal from this fighting dealer!

But for that you have to take care of it. You have to take care of nature. The best thing in nature is water. Let's take care of nature, for some time we can be water exporters, "he said.

It is necessary to look beyond pseudo indigenous romanticisms and objectively understand where the candidates come from and what their class interests are. Within bourgeois democracy, those who run are nothing but puppets of the elites and future lackeys of the imperialist countries. Let's tear the masks off the voters! And if you want to choose, CHOOSE TO FIGHT!

#YoNoVotoLUCHO
#naturainsurrecta # elections2021ecuador #electors #politiquerosecuador #ecuador #water #water #climatic change

texto:
#ATENCIÃ“N La RevoluciÃ³n Ciudadana oficializÃ³ su carta presidencial para las elecciones generales de 2021.

Se trata de AndrÃ©s Arauz Galarza, de 35 aÃ±os, doctor en economÃ­a por la Universidad Nacional AutÃ³noma de MÃ©xico (UNAM), a quien lo acompaÃ±arÃ¡ al expresidente Rafael Correa, quien ahora aparecerÃ­a en la papeleta electoral como candidato a vicepresidente de la RepÃºblica.

Ambos postulantes forman parte de la coaliciÃ³n UniÃ³n por la Esperanza (UNES) que integra a los movimientos polÃ­ticos Centro DemocrÃ¡tico (lista 1) y Fuerza Compromiso Social (lista 5).

ğŸ”ºParticipaciÃ³n de Correa

Aunque Correa actualmente enfrenta acciones judiciales en su contra, no serÃ­a impedido de participar en las elecciones si la sentencia en su contra no estÃ¡ EJECUTORIADA hasta antes de la inscripciÃ³n oficial - prevista entre el 18 de septiembre y el 7 de octubre- de su candidatura en el Consejo Nacional Electoral (CNE).

Sin embargo, debido a los reglamentos que exigen oficialmente una inscripciÃ³n personal, Correa deberÃ¡ viajar a Quito, a la matriz del CNE, por lo que podrÃ­a ser detenido al existir una orden de prisiÃ³n preventiva en su contra por el caso del secuestro de Fernando Balda en BogotÃ¡, en 2012.

El expresidente enfrenta una posible condena de ocho aÃ±os de prisiÃ³n por el delito de cohecho pasivo agravado en el denominado caso Sobornos 2012-2016, que se encuentra en etapa de casaciÃ³n -Ãºltima revisiÃ³n de cÃ³mo fue promulgada la sentencia- en la Corte Nacional de Justicia.

ğŸ”ºTrayectoria de AndrÃ©s Arauz

En la funciÃ³n pÃºblica, Arauz fue asesor del Ministerio de PolÃ­tica EconÃ³mica, subsecretario y viceministro del Ministerio de InversiÃ³n PÃºblica, director del Servicio Nacional de ContrataciÃ³n PÃºblica y ministro coordinador de Conocimiento y Talento Humano.

Esta y mÃ¡s informaciÃ³n en primeraplanaec.wordpress.com

en:
# ATTENTION The Citizen Revolution made its presidential letter official for the general elections of 2021.

This is AndrÃ©s Arauz Galarza, 35, a doctor in economics from the National Autonomous University of Mexico (UNAM), who will be accompanied by former President Rafael Correa, who would now appear on the ballot as a candidate for vice president of the Republic.

Both applicants are part of the UniÃ³n por la Esperanza (UNES) coalition that integrates the political movements Centro DemocrÃ¡tico (list 1) and Fuerza Compromiso Social (list 5).

ğŸ”º Correa's participation

Although Correa is currently facing legal actions against him, he would not be prevented from participating in the elections if the sentence against him is not EXECUTED until before the official registration - scheduled between September 18 and October 7 - of his candidacy in the National Electoral Council (CNE).

However, due to the regulations that officially require a personal registration, Correa must travel to Quito, to the headquarters of the CNE, so he could be arrested due to the existence of a preventive detention order against him in the case of the kidnapping of Fernando Balda in BogotÃ¡, in 2012.

The former president faces a possible sentence of eight years in prison for the crime of aggravated passive bribery in the so-called Bribery 2012-2016 case, which is in the cassation stage - the latest review of how the sentence was enacted - in the National Court of Justice .

ğŸ”º Trajectory of AndrÃ©s Arauz

In the public service, Arauz was an advisor to the Ministry of Economic Policy, undersecretary and vice-minister of the Ministry of Public Investment, director of the National Public Procurement Service and coordinating minister of Knowledge and Human Talent.

This and more information at firstplanaec.wordpress.com

en:
ğŸ”´Identity Capsules - ğŸ‘‰The truths make you uncomfortable:
Laughter ğŸ˜† and outrage is caused by the electoral banner âœ that is getting ready to once again attack the looted nation, demonstrating as so many times which is the true and most lethal pandemic. But ... who really places the rulers? ğŸ—£, What type of analysis does the average Ecuadorian use to decide? How much do we use critical reading / contrasting information sources? ğŸ“šğŸ”
BolÃ­var, at the time of Gran Colombia (1822-1830), said that our people were immature to choose their rulers. Would it be worth it in the 21st century to ask ourselves if it is no longer? ğŸ¤”

Plunged in ignorance and mirages, in biased criteria; based on what they "tell us", on idealization and populism, on morbid and tabloid television shows, on alienating vices, on everything that is easy to digest; everything that makes this country the perfect setting for the atrocity of deception and its accomplice impunity. The problem lies in our consumption habits! These will define the future of Ecuador.

texto:
#SpazioNoticias
#Elecciones2021Ecuador Entre incertidumbres y descontentos la campaÃ±a electoral empieza el jueves 31 de diciembre de 2020 y hay mÃ¡s incertidumbre que certezas para el arranque de ese proceso.

Desde los partidos polÃ­ticos hay preocupaciÃ³n por el cumplimiento del calendario, pues causa inquietud la no resoluciÃ³n de la participaciÃ³n del movimiento Justicia Social en la carrera presidencial, a pesar de que la FunciÃ³n Electoral ha ratificado que los comicios no serÃ¡n postergados.
Otro Ã¡mbito que genera desazÃ³n en las organizaciones polÃ­ticas es la aplicaciÃ³n del protocolo para la prevenciÃ³n del covid-19 durante la jornada proselitista.

Donde Ãºnicamente se aprobaron las caravanas y caminatas como parte de las actividades. En el protocolo, los 221 cantones de Ecuador fueron clasificados en tres categorÃ­as. En la categorÃ­a A se encuentran 20 municipios que tienen mÃ¡s de 100 000 electores, por ejemplo, Quito, Guayaquil y Manta. En esa categorÃ­a se podrÃ¡n hacer caminatas de mÃ¡ximo 200 personas, con distanciamiento social y uso de mascarilla y gel antibacterial.
Fuente: El Comercio
en:
#SpazioNews
# Elecciones2021Ecuador Between uncertainties and discontent, the electoral campaign begins on Thursday, December 31, 2020 and there is more uncertainty than certainty for the start of that process.

The political parties are concerned about compliance with the calendar, as the non-resolution of the participation of the Social Justice movement in the presidential race causes concern, despite the fact that the Electoral Branch has ratified that the elections will not be postponed.
Another area that generates unease in political organizations is the application of the protocol for the prevention of covid-19 during the proselytizing session.

Where only caravans and walks were approved as part of the activities. In the protocol, the 221 cantons of Ecuador were classified into three categories. In category A there are 20 municipalities that have more than 100,000 voters, for example, Quito, Guayaquil and Manta. In this category, walks of a maximum of 200 people can be made, with social distancing and the use of a mask and antibacterial gel.
Source: El Comercio

en:
# ATTENTION Fabricio Correa Delgado joins the list of candidates in search of Carondelet's chair.

This Thursday, August 20, the Social Justice movement -list 11- organized its national convention where it declared that it will increase the candidacy of the brother of former president Rafael Correa, who will double with Marcia Elizabeth Yazbek, president of Women for Ecuador and general manager of Marketing Bureau .

Social Justice - whose leader is Jimmy Salazar, current president of the National Bar Association, husband of Pamela MartÃ­nez, former advisor to Rafael Correa - is one of the four movements facing a suspension process in the National Electoral Council (CNE) for alleged anomalies in your registration.

#MejoremoslopÃºblico #tusideascuentan #guayaquil #babahoyo #coronavirus #clases #ciudadanosprotagonistas #jÃ³venesprotagonistas #diciembre #enero #elecciones #elecciones2021ecuador #elecciones2021ec #ecuadorğŸ‡ªğŸ‡¨
en:
A post that calls for reflection, not only from citizens but also from politicians.
.
.
The official debate held by @cnegobec makes us think about the following.
.
.
What have we done as a country to deserve more of the same in a single debate?

16 candidates proving that it is impossible to govern together.
.
.
16 candidates who based on selfishness are unable to accept the capacity of the other.
.
.
16 candidates with similar unsupported proposals with differences in numbers or percentages to "solve the problems."
.
.
16 candidates who talk about what are we going to do? but not how are we going to do it?
.
.
Candidates who take advantage of their two-minute space to launch their campaign phrase, to answer anything but what they ask or to start rambling and in a few cases to contradict and generate debate with another candidate.
.
.
There were not 1, there were 16 candidates who failed to convince or make anything clear and that is really sad for our Country.
.
.
WE ARE LIEED ON THE FACE.
.
.
There is still talk of foreign investment as if it will be their decision to put the money of an international company in the country, there is still talk of radical changes in the laws such as whether it will be about them to approve the laws without debate, others They think that reducing the VAT will increase the collection and at the same time they also want to eliminate the Tax on the exit of foreign currency, they talk about eliminating or cleaning you from the risk center without any technical support just because someone on the street asks you to do so, some Candidates live frozen in the past, others want to buy your vote and talk about eliminating public institutions without thinking about the people of those institutions.
.
.
Nobody spoke of a real strategic planning based on technical data without lies and progressive in time to start on a different path in 4 years.

HAVING SO MUCH SHIT IS OUR FAULT.

Someone had to say it and how good it was us.
